item.description:
We'll watch and discuss the last of the short videos on topics of interest to humanists that we started at our last meting, a debate sponsored by Intelligence Squared (intelligencesquaredus.org) on whether the world would be better off without religion. The four-person panel included for the motion: Matthew Chapman and A.C. Grayling; against the motion: Dinesh D'Souza and Rabbi David Wolpe. We will watch the opening arguments and discuss the proposition ourselves.

Refreshments will be served.
item.how_to_find_us: We will probably be upstairs in the library, or in the social hall.
item.name: Conversations: Would the World Be Better Off Without Religion?
